wikiData.title: South Carolina v. Baker
wikiData.FullName: South Carolina v. Baker, Secretary of the Treasury on Exceptions to Report of Special Master
wikiData.Holding: Section 310(b)(1) of the Tax Equity and Fiscal Responsibility Act of 1982 (TEFRA) does not violate the Tenth Amendment to the United States Constitution, nor violates the doctrine of intergovernmental tax immunity by taxing the interest earned on unregistered state bonds.
wikiData.JoinMajority: White, Marshall, Blackmun, Stevens; Scalia (except part II)
wikiData.LawsApplied: [[Tenth Amendment to the United States Constitution|U.S. Const. amend X]]; [[Tax Equity and Fiscal Responsibility Act of 1982]]
wikiData.Overturned previous case: ''[[Pollock v. Farmers' Loan & Trust Company]]'', 157 U.S. 429 (1895) (in part)
